summary: This is a superseding indictment (S1 20 Cr. 330) filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury. The indictment details Maxwell's role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of at least three minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and alleges she gave false testimony under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with multiple counts related to conspiring with and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls, including recruiting, grooming, and participating in abuse. Also charged with perjury for false 2016 deposition testimony.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with a sexual preference for underage girls. Maxwell assisted him in accessing and abusing victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Had a personal and professional relationship; were in an intimate relationship from approx. 1994-1997. Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage properties and conspired with him to recruit, groom, and abuse minor girls.
Maxwell facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims, knowing his sexual preference for underage girls and his intent to abuse them. She groomed victims and was present for abuse.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls at various Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Minor Victim-2 Visit to New Mexico Ranch
events.description: Minor Victim-2, under 18, visited Epstein's New Mexico ranch. Maxwell gave her an unsolicited topless massage and encouraged her to massage Epstein.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition (Perjury Count 5)
events.description: During a deposition in civil case 15 Civ. 7433, Maxwell gave false testimony, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and claiming she was unaware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition (Perjury Count 6)
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony about her awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, her knowledge of his sexual activities with others, and whether she had ever given massages to Epstein or Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14 between approximately 1994 and 1997.

The indictment specifies three minor victims (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) and details Maxwell's role in befriending, grooming, and normalizing sexual abuse for them, including through massages and group sexual encounters.
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions, where she denied knowledge of Epstein's scheme and her own involvement.
The abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
The indictment alleges Maxwell facilitated interstate and international travel of minors with the intent that they engage in illegal sexual activity with Epstein.
